Class SimpleFileChooser

java.lang.Object
  SimpleFileChooser

public class SimpleFileChooser
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides a slightly simplified interface to one of Java's standard JFileChooser dialogs. An object of type SimpleFileChooser has methods that allow the user to select files for input or output. If the object is used several times, the same JFileChooser is used each time. By default, the dialog box is set to the user's home directory the first time it is used, and after that it remembers the current directory between one use and the next. However, methods are provided for setting the current directory. (Note: On Windows, the user's home directory will probably mean the user's "My Documents" directory".)

Method Detail

setDefaultDirectory

public void setDefaultDirectory()
Reset the default directory in the dialog box to the user's home directory. The next time the dialog appears, it will show the contents of that directory.

setDefaultDirectory

public void setDefaultDirectory(java.lang.String directoryName)
Set the default directory for the dialog box. The next time the dialog appears, it will show the contents of that directory.

Parameters:
directoryName - A File object that specifies the directory name. If this name is null, then the user's home directory will be used.

setDefaultDirectory

public void setDefaultDirectory(java.io.File directory)
Set the default directory for the dialog box. The next time the dialog appears, it will show the contents of that directory.

Parameters:
directoryName - The name of the new default directory. If the name is null, then the user's home directory will be used.

getInputFile

public java.io.File getInputFile()
Show a dialog box where the user can select a file for reading. This method simply returns getInputFile(null,null).

Returns:
the selected file, or null if the user did not select a file.

getInputFile

public java.io.File getInputFile(java.awt.Component parent)
Show a dialog box where the user can select a file for reading. This method simply returns getInputFile(parent,null).

Returns:
the selected file, or null if the user did not select a file.
See Also:
getInputFile(Component, String)

getInputFile

public java.io.File getInputFile(java.awt.Component parent,
                                 java.lang.String dialogTitle)
Show a dialog box where the user can select a file for reading. If the user cancels the dialog by clicking its "Cancel" button or the Close button in the title bar, then the return value of this method is null. Otherwise, the return value is the selected file. Note that the file has to exist, but it is not guaranteed that the user is allowed to read the file.

Parameters:
parent - If the parent is non-null, then the window that contains the parent component becomes the parent window of the dialog box. This means that the window is "blocked" until the dialog is dismissed. Also, the dialog box's position on the screen should be based on the position of the window. Generally, you should pass your application's main window or panel as the value of this parameter.
dialogTitle - a title to be displayed in the title bar of the dialog box. If the value of this parameter is null, then the dialog title will be "Select Input File".
Returns:
the selected file, or null if the user did not select a file.

getOutputFile

public java.io.File getOutputFile()
Show a dialog box where the user can select a file for writing. This method simply calls getOutputFile(null,null,null)

Returns:
the selcted file, or null if no file was selected.

getOutputFile(Component, String, String)

getOutputFile

public java.io.File getOutputFile(java.awt.Component parent,
                                  java.lang.String dialogTitle,
                                  java.lang.String defaultFile)
Show a dialog box where the user can select a file for writing. If the user cancels the dialog by clicking its "Cancel" button or the Close button in the title bar, then the return value of this method is null. A non-null value indicates that the user specified a file name and that, if the file exists, then the user wants to replace that file. (If the user selects a file that already exists, then the user will be asked whether to replace the existing file.) Note that it is not quaranteed that the selected file is actually writable; the user might not have permission to create or modify the file.

Parameters:
parent - If the parent is non-null, then the window that contains the parent component becomes the parent window of the dialog box. This means that the window is "blocked" until the dialog is dismissed. Also, the dialog box's position on the screen should be based on the position of the window. Generally, you should pass your application's main window or panel as the value of this parameter.
dialogTitle - a title to be displayed in the title bar of the dialog box. If the value of this parameter is null, then the dialog title will be "Select Input File".
defaultFile - when the dialog appears, this name will be filled in as the name of the selected file. If the value of this parameter is null, then the file name box will be empty.
Returns:
the selected file, or null if the user did not select a file.
